answers.answer: Hello.Your symptoms are not specific. They do not point towards any particular neurological deficit. But there are some conditions to be ruled out.Do you have high/low blood pressure, anemia, thyroid dysfunction and/or diabetes? These common conditions should be ruled out.Regards

question: I have had symptoms for years of tremor, slurred speach, stalled speach, short term memory loss, clumsines and on and on.  9 days ago it his a climax.  Most of the time in the past I my symptoms only lasted for hours, or days and were very mild.  This week I haven't even been able to  take care of my kids.  I'm in pain and shaking all of the time.  It seems to effect my right side more and is much worse in the morning.  Every day it gets a little better.  I am 29 years old.  I had an mri in Dec. and it was normal.  I went to a nerologist on  the 2nd and he is running a bunch of blood test, but told me it was probably stress.  This is not the first time that I have been told more or less that it is in my head.  I'm scared and frustrated.  Any help or ideas that you can give me?
title: Tremors, pain, stalled speach,
